reviewText: Great!!!  CBoth CD and DVD are fantastic!!!  Thank you!  Fantastic customer service!
Finally! Rockpile fans rejoice. Pretty good sound and video quality of a solid Rockpile live set.  A must have for fans of the band and of Dave and Nick. Love it!
What a great on again off again band
This item is well worth the money. Sound is good, not great. Picture is a bit grainy but considering when it was recorded it's the best video currently available from this band.

nick  lowe  and  dave  edmunds  where  pretty  much  the  brainstorm  behind  this  breif  but  amazing  super group  that  put  out  that  one  killer  lp  in  1979  titled  rockpile  (  not  to  be  confused  with  the  dave  edmunds  solo  album  of  the  same  title  from  1971)  anyway  this  dvd  is  what  really  sold  me  on  this  fantastic  live  show  as  dave  edmunds  did  not  do  much  live  work  with  rockpile  but  as  you  can  see  he  is  featured  here  on  the  film  from  rockpalast  in  1980,  first  off  this  stuff  both  audio  and  video  are  awesome  live!!!!  it  sounds  even  better  then  the  studio  album,  what  would  have  been  awesome  is  if  they  where  able  to  put  that  live  version  of  little  sister  on  here  that  was  shot  in  the  uk  on  the  sight  and  sound  show  with  robert  plant  getting  up  there  for  the  one  song  but  due  to  licensing  crap  that  was  why  that  was  not  possible  i  suppose,  anyway  this  night  in  january  1980  rockpile  where  on  fire  in  germany,  nick  and  dave  really  rip  it  up  big  time  and  this  show  sounds  awesome  and  very  powerful,  i  will  not  bother  to  complain  about  the  small stuff  like  the  quality  of  the  film  as  it  was  only  restored  in  2013  after  33  years  in  a  vault,  as  i  see  it  the  film  came  out  great!!!  if  you  liked  the  uk  pub  rock  sound  of  brinsley  shwarz,  ,dr  feelgood,  the  hammersmith  gorillas,  ducks  deluxe  and  of  coarse  wilco  johnson  or  eggs  over  easy  then  this  is  a  must  own  for  you  especially  if  you  liked  the  rockpile  project  in  1979  with  that  now  awesome  classic  record  from  that year,  in  recent  years  with  all  the  deluxe  editions  of  classic  releases  coming  out  by  dr  feelgood,  the  jam  or  status  quo  i  am  suprised  the  rockpile  album  has  not  been  deluxed  yet,  i  hope  it  will  be  soon,  anyway  I  WAS  THRILLED  TO  GET  THIS  ROCKPALAST  CD/DVD  SET  and  you  will  be  to  if  you  are  a  fan  of  edmunds  or  lowe.....

This is a real treat for fans of Dave, Nick, Billy, and Terry.  I bought this within a few minutes of seeing it available here on Amazon, with my fingers crossed that it would be GOOD or better, and it is.  I'd say it's great or better, and way damn better than the YouTube videos we Rockpile fans have been watching for years now, especially the audio.  But even the video quality is much better than I would have had the right to hope for, given the fact that this was recorded and directed live on 1970s technology.  It's really directed too, not shot on single cam.  I've watched this on a big screen TV and it holds up well in the big picture.  Set list is solid, Nick and Dave trading off songs with Billy getting a few of his own.  It's the closest I'll ever get to seeing this late great band live, and I am happy to settle for it.  (Another review complains there are no "Seconds of Pleasure" songs on here but that tour and LP was a year away from happening.  They did a US tour on that in 1980, I wonder why that hasn't shown up on DVD yet?)

Before continuing, if you're looking for the STREETWALKERS "Live At Rockpalast" set and keep getting sent here, click here. If you're looking for THE IAN HUNTER BAND with MICK RONSON, click here for CD and here for DVD. I've contacted Amazon about this and hopefully they'll straighten it out...... ROCKPILE's new release "LIVE AT ROCKPALAST" is a classic TV concert that's been restored and released by the great German label Repertoire records in a nice slipcased CD+DVD digipak. It's another great release in this series along with CLIMAX BLUES BAND: Live at Rockpalast 1976, MICKEY JUPP: Live at Rockpalast 1979 and STREEWALKERS: Live At Rockpalast 1975 & 1977...... ROCKPALAST is a legendary `live' music TV show from Germany. It was first broadcast in 1974 and has become a pan-European television institution. It has its own fan club and online forum. There have been many DVDs released over the last few years on different labels, finally making these shows available to fans. The performance here was recorded January 12, 1980 at the Markthalle in Hamburg, Germany and was their only appearance on the show as ROCKPILE (a DAVE EDMUNDS BAND show was broadcast in 1983). The sound and video quality are great and I'm sure the best possible considering the age of the material. All the older shows I've seen from German TV look great, even 'Beat! Beat! Beat!, and that's ancient! If you have any other Rockpalast DVDs, it's similar in quality to those. There are also clips available on YouTube if you want a preview of the contents (don't go by YouTube's picture quality, however)...... ROCKPILE, for all you newbies, was a pub rock/new wave/rock'n'roll supergroup combining the talents of Dave Edmunds (guitar & vocals, ex-LOVE SCULPTURE), Nick Lowe (bass & vocals, ex-BRINSLEY SCHWARZ), Billy Bremner (guitar & vocals, ex-LULU & THE LUVERS) and Terry Williams (drums, ex-MAN). This is an essential release for fans, since the only legitimate ROCKPILE concert release (so far) has been the Live At Montreux 1980 CD. "LIVE AT ROCKPALAST" contains the best and greatest hits from both Dave Edmunds' and Nick Lowe's stellar back catalogues, featuring songs by Mickey Jupp ("You'll Never Get Me Up In One Of Those"), Elvis Costello ("Girls Talk") and Chuck Berry ("Let It Rock" & "Promised Land") along with their own compositions. Strangely enough they don't perform anything from their debut album as ROCKPILE, "SECONDS OF PLEASURE." I was lucky enough to see ROCKPILE twice, opening for Van Morrison and then BLONDIE and both times they stole the show! The informative booklet has dual liner notes; in English by Will Birch, an ex- member of their contemporaries THE KURSAAL FLYERS and THE RECORDS who's now a noted British journalist, broadcaster, author and expert on the Pub Rock and `Southend Rock' scenes (of which DR. FEELGOOD were the leading exponents), and in German by noted journalist and broadcaster Uli Kniep. The Track Listing is: On the Region Free NTSC DVD with a choice of Stereo or 5.1 surround sound: 01. Sweet Little Lisa 02. So It Goes 03. I Knew The Bride (When She Used To Rock And Roll) 04. Switchboard Susan 05. Crawling From The Wreckage 06. Trouble Boys 07. Girls Talk 08. Three Time Loser 09. Born Fighter 10. You'll Never Get Me Up In One Of Those 11. Promised Land 12. Queen Of Hearts 13. They Call It Rock 14. Juju Man 15. Singing The Blues 16. Let It Rock / Let's Talk About Us 17. Down Down Down (aka Feel Like I'm Goin' Down) And on the Remastered Stereo CD: 01. Sweet Little Lisa 02. So It Goes 03. I Knew The Bride (When She Used To Rock And Roll) 04. Switchboard Susan 05. Crawling From The Wreckage 06. Trouble Boys 07. Girls Talk 08. Three Time Loser 09. Born Fighter 10. You'll Never Get Me Up In One Of Those 11. Promised Land 12. Queen Of Hearts 13. They Call It Rock 14. Juju Man 15. Singing The Blues 16. Let It Rock / Let's Talk About Us 17. Down Down Down (aka Feel Like I'm Goin' Down) Some related product you may have interest in: from NICK LOWE: Jesus of Cool,Quiet Please: The New Best of Nick Lowe. from DAVE EDMUNDS: Repeat When Necessary,The Dave Edmunds Anthology 1968-1990 and from BILLY BREMMER: Bash!
